intro: Moricandia arvensis subsp. suffruticosa, commonly known as the field moricandia, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features alternate, pinnately divided leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers in clusters. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. The species is characterized by its robust growth and adaptability to various environmental conditions.
